name: Durlindana und Excalibur
overview: An Italian game by Marco Mietta and published in Commodore 64 Club #04 [Italian Release] in 1988. And here we are in the world of medieval knights and their chivalrous deeds. In this adventure game the protagonist must in fact compete in tournaments on horseback that often take place among the noble warriors. To do this he must obviously prepare himself in time and in an adequate way for his mission. In the weaponsmith's shop you can choose between various types of swords, shields and helmets, which have different performance and costs, or you can reinforce your armor at will, all compatibly with the money you have... The tournaments take place every two, three or four days, and different groups of riders take part in them. Logically, against the strongest opponents you have less chances of victory, but if you manage to defeat them you get higher cash prizes and also, if you have shown particular courage, the possibility of measuring yourself against the King to usurp his kingdom. ambition of each knight and event that represents the victory of the game.
